Explicit Tracking with Wildcard Routes in Multicast VPN
Abstract
contents.ja: 抽象

contents.text: The base Multicast VPN (MVPN) specifications (RFCs 6513 and 6514) provide procedures to allow a multicast ingress node to invoke "explicit tracking" for a multicast flow or set of flows, thus learning the egress nodes for that flow or set of flows. However, the specifications are not completely clear about how the explicit tracking procedures work in certain scenarios. This document provides the necessary clarifications. It also specifies a new, optimized explicit-tracking procedure. This new procedure allows an ingress node, by sending a single message, to request explicit tracking of each of a set of flows, where the set of flows is specified using a wildcard mechanism. This document updates RFCs 6514, 6625, 7524, 7582, and 7900.

1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1. はじめに

contents.text: The base Multicast VPN (MVPN) specifications, [RFC6513] and [RFC6514], define the "Selective Provider Multicast Service Interface Auto-Discovery route" (S-PMSI A-D route).
contents.ja: ベースマルチキャストVPN（MVPN）仕様、[RFC6513]及び[RFC6514]は、 "選択プロバイダマルチキャストサービスインターフェイス自動検出経路"（S-PMSI A-Dのルート）を定義します。

contents.text: Per those RFCs, the S-PMSI A-D route contains a Network Layer Reachability Information (NLRI) field that identifies a particular multicast flow. In the terminology of those RFCs, each flow is denoted by (C-S,C-G), where C-S is an IP source address and C-G is an IP multicast address, both in the address space of a VPN customer. The (C-S,C-G) of the multicast flow is encoded into the NLRI field.
contents.ja: それらのRFCあたり、S-PMSI A-Dの経路は、特定のマルチキャストフローを識別するネットワーク層到達可能性情報（NLRI）フィールドを含みます。これらのRFCの用語では、各フローは、C-Sは、IP送信元アドレス及びC-Gであり、（C-S、C-G）で示される両方のVPN顧客のアドレス空間で、IPマルチキャストアドレスです。マルチキャストフローの（C-S、C-G）はNLRIフィールドに符号化されます。

contents.text: An S-PMSI A-D route also carries a PMSI Tunnel attribute (PTA). Typically, the PTA is used to identify a tunnel through the provider backbone network (a "P-tunnel").
contents.ja: S-PMSI A-Dの経路はまた、PMSIトンネル属性（PTA）を運びます。典型的には、PTAは、プロバイダバックボーンネットワークを介してトンネル（「P-トンネル」）を識別するために使用されます。

contents.text: By originating an S-PMSI A-D route identifying a particular multicast flow and a particular P-tunnel, a node is advertising the following:
contents.ja: 特定のマルチキャストフローと特定のP-トンネルを識別するS-PMSI A-Dの経路を発信することによって、ノードは、次のように広告されています。

contents.text: If the node has to transmit packets of the identified flow over the backbone, it will transmit them through the identified tunnel.
contents.ja: ノードは、バックボーン上識別されたフローのパケットを送信する必要がある場合、それは、識別されたトンネルを介してそれらを送信します。

contents.text: [RFC6513] and [RFC6514] also define a procedure that allows an ingress node of a particular multicast flow to determine the set of egress nodes that have requested to receive that flow from that ingress node. The ability of an ingress node to identify the egress nodes for a particular flow is known as "explicit tracking". An ingress node requests explicit tracking by setting a flag (the "Leaf Information Required" flag, or LIR flag) in the PTA. When an egress node receives an S-PMSI A-D route with the LIR flag set, the egress node originates a Leaf A-D route whose NLRI field contains the NLRI from the corresponding S-PMSI A-D route. In this way, the egress node advertises that it has requested to receive the particular flow identified in the NLRI of that S-PMSI A-D route.
contents.ja: [RFC6513]及び[RFC6514]は、特定のマルチキャストフローの入口ノードは、その入口ノードからの流れを受けるように要求した出口ノードのセットを決定することを可能にする手順を定義します。特定のフローのための出口ノードを識別するための入口ノードの能力は「明示的なトラッキング」として知られています。入口ノードは、PTAのフラグ（「リーフ必要な情報」フラグ、またはLIRフラグ）を設定することにより、明示的な追跡を要求します。出口ノードは、LIRのフラグが設定されたS-PMSI A-Dの経路を受信した場合、出口ノードは、そのNLRIフィールド対応するS-PMSI A-Dの経路からNLRIが含まリーフA-Dの経路を発信します。このように、出口ノードは、それがS-PMSI A-D経路のNLRIに識別された特定のフローを受信するように要求したことを通知します。

contents.text: [RFC6513] and [RFC6514] also allow an ingress node to originate an S-PMSI A-D route whose PTA has the LIR flag set but that does not identify any P-tunnel. This mechanism can be used when desired to do explicit tracking of a flow without at the same time binding that flow to a particular P-tunnel.
contents.ja: [RFC6513]及び[RFC6514]もPTA LIRフラグがセットされているが、それは、任意のP-トンネルを識別しないS-PMSI A-Dの経路を発信するための入口ノードを許します。所望の場合、このメカニズムは、同時に特定のP-トンネルにその流れを結合せず、フローの明示的なトラッキングを行うために使用することができます。

contents.text: [RFC6625] (and other RFCs that update it) extends the specification of S-PMSI A-D routes and allows an S-PMSI A-D route to encode a wildcard in its NLRI. Either the C-S or the C-G or both can be replaced by wildcards. These routes are known as (C-*,C-S) S-PMSI A-D routes, (C-S,C-*) S-PMSI A-D routes, or (C-*,C-*) S-PMSI A-D routes, depending on whether the C-S or C-G or both have been replaced by wildcards. These routes are known jointly as "wildcard S-PMSI A-D routes".

contents.text: One purpose of this document is to clarify the way that the explicit tracking procedures of [RFC6513] and [RFC6514] are applied when wildcard S-PMSI A-D routes are used.

Suppose an ingress node originates an S-PMSI A-D route whose NLRI specifies, for example, (C-*,C-*) (i.e., both C-S and C-G are replaced by wildcards) and whose PTA identifies a particular P-tunnel. Now suppose that the ingress node wants explicit tracking for each individual flow that it transmits (following the procedures of [RFC6625]) on that P-tunnel.

contents.text: 2. The Explicit-Tracking Flags
contents.ja: 2.明示的なトラッキングフラグ

contents.text: [RFC6514] defines one flag in the PTA, the "Leaf Information Required" (LIR) flag, that is used for explicit tracking.

contents.text: This document defines a new flag in the Flags field of the PMSI Tunnel attribute. This new flag is known as the "Leaf Information Required per Flow" flag (LIR-pF). This flag may be set in the PTA of a (C-*,C-*), (C-*,C-G), or (C-S,C-*) S-PMSI A-D route. The conditions under which it should be set by the originator of the route are discussed in Section 4. The significance of the flag in a received wildcard S-PMSI A-D route is discussed in Sections 5 and 5.2.

contents.text: 5.3. When the Egress Node Is an ABR or ASBR
contents.ja: 5.3.  Egressノードは、ABRまたはASBRされたとき

contents.text: When segmented P-tunnels are used, the ingress and egress nodes may be ABRs or ASBRs. An egress ABR/ASBR that receives and installs an S-PMSI A-D route also forwards that route. If the received PTA of an installed S-PMSI A-D route specifies a tunnel, the egress ABR/ASBR MAY change the PTA before forwarding the route, in order to specify a different tunnel type (as discussed in [RFC6514] and/or [RFC7524]). The egress ABR/ASBR may also need to originate a Leaf A-D route, as specified in [RFC6514] and/or [RFC7524].

contents.text: Suppose the S-PMSI A-D route as received has a PTA specifying a tunnel and also has the LIR-pF flag set. The egress ABR/ASBR originates a corresponding Leaf A-D route for a given (C-S,C-G) only if it knows that it needs to receive that flow. It will know this by virtue of receiving a corresponding Leaf A-D route from downstream. contents.text: The procedures in the remainder of this section apply only when an egress ABR/ASBR has installed an S-PMSI A-D route whose PTA as received specifies "no tunnel information present" but has the LIR flag or the LIR-pF flag set.

contents.text: If the received PTA of the installed S-PMSI A-D route specifies "no tunnel information present", the egress ABR/ASBR MUST pass the PTA along unchanged when it forwards the S-PMSI A-D route. (That is, a PTA specifying "no tunnel information present" MUST NOT be changed into a PTA specifying a tunnel.) contents.text: As a result of propagating such an S-PMSI A-D route, the egress ABR/ ASBR may receive one or more Leaf A-D routes that correspond to that S-PMSI A-D route. The egress ABR/ASBR will propagate these Leaf A-D routes after changing the RT as follows. The Global Administrator field of the modified RT will be set to the IP address taken either from the S-PMSI A-D route's Next-Hop field [RFC6514] or its Segmented Point-to-Multipoint (P2MP) Next-Hop Extended Community [RFC7524]. contents.text: 8. Security Considerations
contents.ja: 8.セキュリティの考慮事項

contents.text: The Security Considerations of [RFC6513] and [RFC6514] apply.
contents.ja: [RFC6513]と[RFC6514]のセキュリティについての考慮事項が適用されます。

contents.text: By setting the LIR-pF flag in a single wildcard S-PMSI A-D route, a large number of Leaf A-D routes can be elicited. If this flag is set when not desired (through either error or malfeasance), a significant increase in control plane overhead can result. Properly protecting the control plane should prevent this kind of attack.
contents.ja: 単一のワイルドカードS-PMSI A-Dの経路にLIR-pFのフラグを設定することにより、リーフA-D経路の多数誘発することができます。 （エラーや不正行為のいずれかを介して）、所望しない場合、このフラグがセットされていれば、制御プレーンのオーバーヘッドの大幅な増加をもたらすことができます。適切にコントロールプレーンを保護することはこの種の攻撃を防ぐ必要があります。

contents.text: In the event such an attack occurs, mitigating it is unfortunately not very straightforward. The ingress node can take note of the fact that it is getting, in response to an S-PMSI A-D route that has LIR-pF clear, one or more Leaf A-D routes that have LIR-pF set. By default, the reception of such a route MUST be logged. However, it is possible for such log entries to be "false positives" that generate a lot of "noise" in the log; therefore, implementations SHOULD have a knob to disable this logging.
contents.ja: このような攻撃が発生した場合には、それを緩和することは、残念ながら非常に簡単ではありません。入口ノードは、LIR-pFのセットを有するLIR-pFの明確な、一つ以上のリーフA-Dの経路を有するS-PMSI A-Dの経路に応じて、取得されていることに留意することができます。デフォルトでは、このような経路の受信がログインしている必要があります。そのようなログエントリがログに「ノイズ」の多くを生成する「偽陽性」であるためにしかし、それは可能です。そのため、実装は、このログを無効にするノブを持っているべきです。

contents.text: In theory, if one or more Leaf A-D routes with LIR-pF set arrive in response to an S-PMSI A-D route with LIR-pF clear, withdrawing the S-PMSI A-D route could put a stop to the attack. In practice, that is not likely to be a very good strategy, because:
contents.ja: 理論的には、LIR-pFの有する1つまたは複数のリーフA-Dのルートが攻撃に終止符を打つことができS-PMSI A-Dの経路を引き出す、クリアLIR-pF程度とS-PMSI A-Dの経路に応じて到着した場合。実際には、それはので、非常に良い戦略である可能性が高いではありません。

contents.text: o Under normal operating conditions, there are some race conditions that may cause the ingress node to think it is being attacked, when in fact it is not.
contents.ja: 通常の動作条件の下ではO、入口ノードは、実際にはそれがないとき、それは、攻撃されていると思うすることがあり、いくつかの競合状態があります。

contents.text: o If some egress nodes have a bug that causes them to set LIR-pF when it should be clear, withdrawing the S-PMSI A-D route will stop the flow of multicast data traffic to all the egress nodes, causing an unnecessary customer-visible disruption.
contents.ja: Oいくつかの出口ノードは不要なお客様可視混乱を引き起こし、それは明らかであるとき、彼らはすべての出口ノードにマルチキャストデータトラフィックのフローを停止しますS-PMSIのADルートを引き出す、LIR-pFのを設定する原因となるバグを持っている場合。

contents.text: o The same situation that caused the S-PMSI A-D route to be originated in the first place will still exist after the S-PMSI A-D route is withdrawn, so the route will just be re-originated.
contents.ja: O S-PMSI A-Dの経路を引き起こし、同じ状況が依然としてS-PMSI A-D経路が引き抜かれた後に存在する最初の場所に由来するので、ルートだけを再発信します。

contents.text: In other words, any action that would ameliorate the effects of this sort of attack would likely have a negative effect during normal operation. Therefore, it is really better to rely on security mechanisms that protect the control plane generally than to have a mechanism that is focused on this one particular type of attack.
contents.ja: 言い換えれば、この種の攻撃の影響を改善する任意のアクションはおそらく、通常動作時に負の効果を持っているでしょう。したがって、一般的に、攻撃のこの1つの特定のタイプに焦点を当てているメカニズムを持っているよりも、コントロールプレーンを保護するセキュリティメカニズムに依存していることは本当に良いです。
